website_summaries.verdict: Dump the Wi-Fi extenders with this massive 8-antenna router that handles numerous devices with aplomb.
pros: Outstanding range, and ability to handle multiple high-bandwidth-demand devices
Can set up several guest networks
Easy to set up and not too difficult to configure most functions
cons: Can run fairly hot during high bandwidth use
Some users have trouble with frequent connection drops
Web portal lists only basic information about router performance

website_summaries.verdict: If you have an extremely fast broadband connection and want an all-powerful home network, the Linksys EA9500 fits the bill. But a different router with more modest specs will satisfy most.
pros: The Linksys EA9500 has a whopping eight Gigabit LAN ports and stellar Wi-Fi performance and supports seamless roaming, which is useful if you need to extend your network The router's Parental Control feature can block https websites
cons: The router is expensive and extremely bulky and its specs are overkill for most homes

customer_reviews.title: When it was working the performance was not noticeably better than the $100 wifi router it replaced
customer_reviews.text: This is the last thing I ever buy from Linksys. For the amount that this thing cost it should work all the time. After less than one year of use it started rebooting itself. When I called their Helpless Desk they did not comprehend me when I said, "Today it started rebooting itself." The 'tech' did not know what the phrase reboot meant! So my router is down. They wanted me to log into it. I told them how am I going to log into to it if it is rebooting all the time? When it was working the performance was not noticeably better than the $100 wifi router it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dimick

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent Disconnect - Same issue as other reviewers.
customer_reviews.text: Worst router ever. Had it for 2 month. Started to have intermittent disconnect wifi and internet. See other review. Same issue. Called customer service. They could not fix it, so they told me to contact senior technician which will cost $149. Beware. Let this be a warning. Email me if you have questions.
customer_reviews.author: Tam V. Do

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money... Drops signal hourly
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase this router. It's a waste of money. Mine is 6 months old and while it's really easy to setup, the connectivity is horrible. First month it was great for 2.4ghz only, as the 5ghz dropped signal every hour. I figured it was no big deal since I primarily used 2.4, however for last 2 months, it drops every hour or so. I'm so angry I wasted this money. Linksys used to be first choice for everything but not now. Tech support is also not existent.
customer_reviews.author: NightHawk

customer_reviews.title: Long Range router BUT poor performance on 2.4Ghz, and average results on 5Ghz. Good built quality and customer service
customer_reviews.text: This router has a solid spec sheet and feature list to justify its high price, however real life performance on the 2.4Ghz band is mediocre at best. I planned on replacing an old Asus RT-AC however, my old router performs significantly better in both 2.4 and 5Ghz bands. Updated firmware with no performance improvements. Contacted Linksys tech support (which was great) and spent an hour troubleshooting and manually calibrating different setting was no improvements. Range was very good (reach in distance) and although you may get away with just this router to cover a large home, the speeds dropped significantly when you moved away from router. Build quality is great, setup was easy, and customer service was good.
customer_reviews.author: AVale

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Product and Support - Expensive Doesn't Always Mean "Best"
customer_reviews.text: Have had horrible performance out of this router not only on Wi-Fi, but also on file throughput just copying files from one device to another while both devices are hardwired into the router. Terrible support. They just want to default to asking you to do a factory reset and update to the latest firmware. After countless hours, none of their suggestions fixed any of the 3 major issues I'm having. I may just do a factory reset and sell it as used to the next sucker in line and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: MSStateDawg

customer_reviews.title: Firmware is truly flawed
customer_reviews.text: The hardware itself and its range is great for basic use but not with that price. The problem is their firmware with trying to use its "advance" features which will drop your connections on and off all day long. Even their "advance" features is totally missing vs other routers who have fully advanced working features. This router was dumbed down features. Search their forum and its the same problems. Nothing but grief when trying to stabilize the connections and features cache errors forcing you to do factory reset to get it stable. You basically dont customize in order to get it stay connected which defeats the purpose. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Dexter

customer_reviews.title: Super strong signals cover our huge house very well
customer_reviews.text: The web page interface is pretty much the same as our last Linksys router and is very well setup and easy to use. This huge router has 8 antennas and gets the signal further around our big 3700sf plus house then the smaller one we had for the last 5 years. This is a great improvement. This thing has several wireless networks on it which is great when you have lots of automated things in your house like light controls, cameras, TVs, phones, tablets, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Vegas Ross

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: This unit was purchased to replace a 8 year old router which had trouble streaming Netflix, Hulu, etc. Our internet is relatively fast and this router, after several months of use, has been awesome. The buffering and wait times to load are non existent. There are several TV's in the house, 2 computers, and several phones and I-pads that are constantly connected and it keeps up perfectly. The setup was really easy and only took a few minutes. I purchased a less expensive unit for my office and wish I had of went ahead and purchased another one of these. I think it is well worth the extra dollars and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Network Map is Inaccurate and Defective
customer_reviews.text: The Network MAP doesn't recognize and list all devices connected to the router. Therefore, unable to take advantage of ALL features of the router such as Device Prioritization, Parental Control, etc. Researched online and appears to be a common problem. $300 is a high-end cost for a-c type router and this critical of an issue can't be tolerated for a high priced router. Note: The Devices that aren't listed in the Network Map were fully functional and were provided network / internet connectivity by the router. For some odd reason the Network Map just doesn't display or list all the the Devices that are connected to the router.
customer_reviews.author: D Shams

customer_reviews.title: Great speeds. Poor admin interface. Useless parental controls & firewall.
customer_reviews.text: The Linksys Max-Stream AC5400 is pretty good so far. The radios seem better than the unit it replaced, as I'm getting stronger measured signal throughout my house. The wireless client access speeds are significantly improved. * The administrative interface is not great, but functional. * The parental controls are basically useless. That's really the biggest issue I have. I've gone with a combination of 2 other products to help offset the parental control issue. * The visible firewall/routing features are poor, and require additional equipment in my case. I expected more at this price point. I'll be happy enough with this if it continues functioning reliably. But to me, it seems like more of an access point than a router.
customer_reviews.author: Kurtis B

customer_reviews.title: it works constantly
customer_reviews.text: I have used router in the office for years, and when they start to go, I buy a new one. this is working very well, and better than the one I had (cisco). key benefit: i can plug in all of my computer stuff directly to the router with the ports - I have multiple computers + dsl phone. I think my old router had only 4 ports and that led to a switch. more ports & now I don't need the extra device. when I moved my office fully, I had to unplug everything. once I turned everything back on, the router picked up without missing a beat. everything worked again without a fuss. nice.
customer_reviews.author: Boston suburban dweller

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy Refurbished!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these routers refurb from Amazon. They say refurbished by Linksys. So one of them died within the 90 days and they replaced it. The other died after 8 months (stopped transmitting) and support said, sorry, you bought refurbished. They wouldn't stand behind a $300 router that lasted only 8 months. And both routers are useless. Granted the replacement for one of them is still working, but really, I think I'm moving on to another company. I suspect these refurbished products are priced way too high given the likelihood they will fail in the first 9 months. Too much money to risk. And as a customer for 12 years of Linksys, time to drop them.
customer_reviews.author: JLM

customer_reviews.title: Solved my Problems with VPN and Many Devices.
customer_reviews.text: In the past I've always purchased cheaper Linksys models because they also boast support for a high number of devices. Lately though, I was having trouble with devices getting disconnected and with patchy performance using VPN when working from home. I decided to try this more expensive model because of the tri-band technology. I wasn't sure it would solve my problems. I was pleasantly surprised to find that it solved all of them. I now maintain a smooth VPN connection while sharing screen over Skype and I never experience random dropped connections on my mobile devices. Definitely worth spending the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Asbach

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Netgear Nighthawk X10(R9000), to replace an older Linksys router, could not get the Nighthawk to work, could not get through to Netgear technical support for assistance, so I returned it. I subsequently purchased a Linksys AC5400, (EA9500), connected effortlessly, as well as quickly, did not need any technical assistance from Linksys and it is working flawlessly. I have to admit, I also feel a greater sense of confidence in the future with the Linksys 3year tech assist and 3 year unit warranty as well. The EA9500 has exceeded my expectations and is also even supporting my Netgear Arlo Wireless Camera Security System superbly. I could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: End of Life - No support
customer_reviews.text: My EA9500 started to go into a reboot loop which a factory reset did not resolve. I contacted support and was informed this is a known issue with the hardware and nothing can be done since the router is out of warranty. I spoke with a Supervisor and was advised to purchase a new router. I asked if I can send mine in for repair or get a refurbished unit and was told that's not possible and the EA9500 is discontinued. I spent $400 on this router and it didn't even last 5 years. My advice is to go with a different brand that can at least offer customers a solution other than "buy a brand new router".
customer_reviews.author: ed

customer_reviews.title: Guest network security is clumsy.
customer_reviews.text: The Guest network is an open network that is password protected via a landing page, like you might see in a hotel. This means you can't use it for Internet-of-Things devices (which you might want to do if you want to keep them separate from devices on your primary network), and that regular guests will have to keep re-entering the password because the lease will expire. Which means that my work-issued laptop, which I prefer to have on a separate network from my personal gear, will also require regular re-entry of the password. Clumsy.
customer_reviews.author: J Lawrence Buell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, Not able to customize and Crapped out within a week of purchasing it.
customer_reviews.text: Spend an entire evening setting this router up, got network running and Speeds in LAN were awesome. Problem started after two days, router dropped internet connection constantly, it did not matter if it was wired or wireless. Problem got so bad, it would not connect even after rebooting all network units (Modem, router, switch hubs, and clients). I did some research online and long and behold, my problem was not unique. With that said, I had enough and returned the damn thing (lucky me, it took a dump during the return window). I went ahead and got NetGear nighthawk AD7200, I am hoping it won't be a disappointment as some of reviewers claim to be.
customer_reviews.author: DEA

customer_reviews.title: Slow wired speeds
customer_reviews.text: While it works well otherwise, the wired speeds are lame. I have gigabit service and when I plug my laptop into the service line I see 950Mbps up/down. When plugged into this router I only see 380Mbps with nothing else going on (WiFi turned off no other devices connected). After talking to tech support, many resets and firmware upgrades/downgrades the speeds are now up to 410Mbps. That wastes half my bandwidth. No more linksys for me
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Linksys EA9500 AC5400 Does NOT work with an external hard drive and Apple TimeMachine
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for a home to "upgrade" my wifi based on the reviews. I would say that the coverage is better than what I had with my Apple Routers. But if you plug in an external Hard Drive into the back of the router, it does NOT work with Apple Time Machine. I spent over two ours with Linksys Tech Support and they had no clue. So I went to the Linksys website and sure enough there were complaints that Linksys does not work with Time Machine. Yet Asus, Apple of course and others do. I would not buy another Linksys.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: AC1750 had better range and overall worked better - this unit is Soo not as good at the $80 version
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to maybe extend the WiFi range in my home, it simply is not as good as the AC1750 for $89. paying 3 times as much for same, or in my case worse, performance will frustrate you. update - I still have it - still fighting to get it working right. the firmware is soo bad you cant tweak this thing to keep it from IP conflits when you have a lot of devices - this unit is Soo not as good at the $80 version
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Miletti

customer_reviews.title: the router is great, but the ones shipped from Amazon are V1
customer_reviews.text: This is kind of tough: the router is great, but the ones shipped from Amazon are V1, and there's an updated V2 available (quad-core 1.8 GHz vs dual-core 1.4 GHz in the V1, more memory, two USB 3 vs 1 USB 3+ 1 USB 2). I could not figure out how to order a V2 from Amazon... so for anyone considering this modem: I like it, but you can get a V2 from Best Buy for the same price (do it in person: look for the two USB 3 ports for a V2 in the photo on the box).
customer_reviews.author: Rog

customer_reviews.title: Bad power supply in units
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a 8 port router. The packaging was great. Solid workmanship. But it did not work. Started rebooting, the very first day, by the end of the week. Complete failure. Contact linksys support. They couldn't help. They said to send it back. Purchase a second one, at a different vendor. It failed the very first day. I think the power board on this unit is the problem. Hate to say, don't buy this model. I purchased the one below it. The 4000 model. It works perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Carl Boston

customer_reviews.title: WiFi spotty at best 6 months in and wired now slowing.  Definitely NOT recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have quite a few WiFi devices on my network. Ring bell and 2 cams, 4 Alexas, 2 firestisks, 2 chromecasts, 2 tablets, 3 smart plugs. Early on it seemed to work okay. Six months in and things drop on and off all day. Rebooting doesn't help. Video breaks up and freezes. Cable Modem consistent at 1 GPS. Nothing helps. Total lack of firmware updates as well so problems aren't getting fixed. Now even the wired network is loosing speed. Nothing got added, it's just slowly dying. Definitely NOT recommended!
customer_reviews.author: C. P.

customer_reviews.title: WiFi consistently dropped
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the AC5400 router, and after 4 months of usage, I can confidently assure you that it’s a very unreliable router for its price. My WiFi connection consistently keeps on dropping even when I’m in the same room of the router! This keep causes my phone to consistently switch to LTE and other devices often time randomly lose connection. I’m extremely disappointed of its performance and don’t know what to do with it now.
customer_reviews.author: Robotic

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced, poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: At this point it's a way overpriced paper weight. The 2.4GHz band only worked for about 12 hours and I've yet to get it working again with help from their Twitter support. The 5GHz band works decent most of the time but still cuts out occasionally. Customer service is devent, but apparently the problem I'm having is somewhat common and I've yet to find a solution. The only benefit of this thing is the 8 ethernet ports, which is the main reason I bought it. Unfortunately at this point I would not recommend this item. Will update if I ever get it figured out or just return it and try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Very good product ..
customer_reviews.text: Granted I had it for about a day but the product seems to be rock solid ...I had to return it because it's admin interface has some gaps. I have old Wirelss-G router with linksys and it is more usable and gives more info, both on computer and mobile site. This linksys router's parental control is buggy. Even if you block the device, it could still use whatsapp chat. Also, in old routers, you could see outgoing logs on the mobile device. There is no way to do so with new linksys admin interface. Advice to product owners, making product, functionality less usable, doesn't make it nextgen, making UI more flashy doesn't make it either...
customer_reviews.author: Devalkumar Mehta

customer_reviews.title: Unexpected error 2183 when trying to modify (or turn off) parental controls
customer_reviews.text: Parental controls do not work and Linksys support does not have a clue to fix it, other than reset the router back to the default. I have the latest firmware update. I have 20+ years of experience as an IT professional. Hardware manufactures should support features they include in their products.
customer_reviews.author: MCPO_RET

customer_reviews.title: Great Router for someone with 68 wireless devices
customer_reviews.text: At this time I have canceled my cable and running on an internet speed at 150mgb up and 150mgb down. We stream iTunes to four televisions using Apple TVs and a seven terabit drive storing all my shows that we have bought on iTunes. On top of that, we have the Apple HomeKit running in the house controlling everything from the thermostat to the locks on the doors. Since I switched to using this router, I have had no problems streaming to all the TVs at the same time as well as keeping all 68 wireless devices up and running smoothly. I would recommend​ this router for anyone that uses a lot of devices.
customer_reviews.author: David Hung

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: Bought this through Amazon and the documentation had a Wifi name different than on the bottom of my router. It was broadcasting a totally different Wifi name. Of course this was a thorough pain and took some time to figure out what the heck was wrong. Linksys support got it figured out with the serial number and assured me it was a new unit but seems odd. He said Amazon tests them and could have put wrong documentation in the box. Not sure why they would open brand new units. Other than that it fixed our speed issues with Spectrum and am happy with it. Have to say Linksys support was very good with the issue as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Range is the only issue for me
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this router in December 2017 and it has performed just fine using 13 connected devices without issue. Speed test shows it allows the 450mbps down and 20mbps speeds provided by Spectrum to come through. Three firesticks can stream simultaneously without buffering. The only complaint is range. We live in a 3,000sqft single story home and I had to buy a range extender for the bedrooms on the other end of the home. Purchasing a Netgear X12 today to see of its any better.
customer_reviews.author: Duane

customer_reviews.title: Just didn't help
customer_reviews.text: Our internet provider is HORRIBLE (Bevcom). Once they bought our local phone company the service became AWFUL and they will NOT do ANYTHING to correct issue. NOTHING! Just blame our location, (house is in same spot as it was with other phone company had the contract. Bevcom, we live to a flat area, too far from the road... anyhow, someone suggested with try a good router to boost service... It didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Iolanthe

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.text: We had high hopes for this guy but despite its super fast 5GHz speed, it falls short on one major component -- blocking sites! We bought this unit specifically because it claims that you can block specific websites. We wanted to block social media sites from our business office so employees aren't surfing them all day long (at least on their computers.) However, the IT gal called Linksys customer service and was told that this functionality hasn't been working and they have no idea when and if the developers will be able to make it work! WHAT!!!??? What good are PARENTAL CONTROLS if they don't work? This guy is going back to Linksys!
customer_reviews.author: online-shopping-addict

customer_reviews.title: Yes this handled 5 gamers/3 twitch streamers
customer_reviews.text: When I invested in this router I hoped for reliability, ease of use, blazing speeds, security, and easy fixing. All of that is what I got. This router handled 5 gamers at college all 3 semesters. If there was ever an issue with internet the router was never the source. The app could use some work but if you need a router to handle heavy and I mean heavy traffic I would without a doubt reccomend this. Also 3 of the 5 gamers also streamed on twitch including myself. So I invested in what I predicted to be the best of the best and that is exactly what I got!
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Speed Drops to 1 mbps
customer_reviews.text: Linksys AC5400 Router - Speed drops to 1 mbps - Not Happy Devices connect at high speed for a short time then speed drops to 1 mbps. Then you need to disconnect and reconnect device to get speed above 1 mbps. Poor customer service. They email and promise to call to resolve but did not. This is only 90 days old. They have problems with router ver 1.1 Google it! Linksys shipped a replacement router also at ver 1.1 I still have same problem. Very Very Unhappy. $419. wasted on the Junk Linksys router AC5400 / EA9500 .
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Serious DNS bug if you have a home Windows Server running Active Directory.
customer_reviews.text: Do not use this if you have an Windows Domain controller in your home network. It has a serious DNS bug in it's DHCP server and will not work correctly. The bug is a known issue since at least 2016 and Linksys has never fixed it.. There is still no fix and their tech support doesn't even seem to understand it is a problem. It may be ok, maybe even great, if you have a simple home network, I don't so I can't test that. I gave it two stars as it is a decent router/wireless access point. But from my perspective this is a serious problem, and tech support has been worthless on the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Whitekn3

customer_reviews.title: Ease of set up
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Linksys routers for years, why? Because of there ease of setup right out of the box. The EA9500 almost sets its self up and if there is a problem the customer service is great, they will walk you through every step to eliminate the issue. I have numerous electronic devices throughout our three bedroom house and every device works like it has its own Separate router.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C Strome

customer_reviews.title: High energy WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best WiFi router I’ve ever purchased! Easy to install and connect and flawless internet. We are running 250mbps internet and get a consistent 230+ via 5G connectivity and 100mbps WiFi. The interesting thing is that the router isn’t dividing our service, we are getting maximum high speeds via multiple devices simultaneously with no hiccups. This router was expensive, but worth the money. Also, we have a 2400 sq. Ft. Home and it covers every part. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: MrJingoSmiles

customer_reviews.title: Wireless on Steroids
customer_reviews.text: The Linksys AC5400 Tri Band Wireless Router has been the best purchase of the century. We have a 4300 square ft. home and even though the house has a "Smart Box" that is suppose to provide wireless capabilities throughout the home, the initial set up did not meet the home needs. Teaming the Linksys AC5400 Tri Band Wireless Router and the Next-Generation ARRIS SURF board SB8200 created the wireless coverage for the entire home. Linksys has always been our first choice for router usage. We needed a huge upgrade; from 1800 sq ft to 4300 sq ft; and received an excellent product for the new space in the Linksys AC5400.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Performance!
customer_reviews.text: Despite the rave reviews I hesitated to buy this when the price dropped as I didn't realize how much better WiFi could be. I had just gotten used to slower speeds in remote rooms. We also noticed interference in the past whenever the microwave ran. Everyone in the family noticed things those issues were all gone. Speedtest.net now shows our full 100 Mb download speed (our maximum) in our room furthest from the router. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Muenchen

customer_reviews.title: Regret this purchase
customer_reviews.text: This review is for Linksys Max-Stream AC5400 MU-MIMO Tri-Band Wireless Smart WiFi Router (EA9500) I thought I was buying a high end router, but that is not the case. This router has to constantly be restarted and it's a major pain. Every Chromecast device I own, about 14 including CCA's, constantly disconnect and reconnect. This didn't happen with my previous budget router. The admin panel is limited as well. If you're looking for a high end router steer clear of this model. Now considering a Nighthawk because this thing isn't cutting it.
customer_reviews.author: darqman

customer_reviews.title: It payes to purchase a solid top end unit for WIFI
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a few WIFI units over the past 6 years and each had their quirks. Most were in the $140.00 range and lasted about 2 years with many glitches. None of the other companies had any interest in real upgrades to sustain these devices. In fact, most of the problems were the result of very flakey firmware updates and a few were fatal. So I moved upstream to this unit and it has been flawless from day one. My tech knowledge is above average and my RF knowledge is way above average.
customer_reviews.author: P W

customer_reviews.title: Item not as described.  It was open and used.  Visible signs of wear and tear.
customer_reviews.text: Returned item since it was not new as advertised. It was open and used with visible signs of wear and tear. Contacted seller #1 Tech by Email and they replied was: "Due to the volume of online orders during the pandemic, it is possible for one of the fulfillment employees to have made a mistake." Very disappointed. I should have read previous reviews before ordering this item. Others have complained about the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Segarra

customer_reviews.title: Good coverage; intuitive user interface
customer_reviews.text: I have used several WiFi routers over the years, some from LinkSys, some from competitors. This router is the easiest to get up and running. I am connected to AT&T fiber and was easily able to change so that the LinkSys router is handling all my ethernet and WiFi traffic. There was an initial conflict with IP home addresses, but a call to tech support got this resolved in a single call. Good product. Good support. Easy to Use. Can't think of a reason to use anything else.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for this house
customer_reviews.text: Amazing for this house. Our daughter always had trouble in her room in the corner of the house. She just moved into the mother-in-law space downstairs and the wi-fi certainly wouldn't work down there. She bought a wi-fi extender to no avail. I got this router and everything is solved. Easy to set up and it really is like having a dedicated router for each device. I'll update as necessary, but I don't see having any problems with this crazy thing that's putting all sorts of strange, possibly unhealthy vibrations into our bodies. Go fast wi-fi?.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Dean

customer_reviews.title: Love this router, very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This router is so much better than our last one. We can connect more devices and none have any trouble with playback so far. Right now we have 18 devices connected at all times including 2 desktop computers, 1 tablet, 1 2-in-1, a Sonos speaker system with 5 speakers, an Amazon Echo, Xbox One, 3 wemo smart outlets, 2 smart phones, and 1 TV. I also have a better range for connection than with our old router. So far I'm very impressed with this router. It was incredibly easy to set up and the Linksys app that you can get on the Android phone is very easy to use and makes things very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: T. Vrba

customer_reviews.title: Great Router so far
customer_reviews.text: I have always had great luck with Linksys. My netgear this is replacing loses firmware during a power cycle, Netgear tech support was terrible. I got this EA9500 and it has been great. I'm getting 118mps download on my 100meg service! My wifi works much better out in the garage and yard. I highly recommend Linksys products! The app is pretty neat. It is super easy to setup but I use the advance functions.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great coverage and bandwidth - Do not buy if you want Parental Control
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a Netgear cable modem/wireless router which lasted less than 15 months. Looking forward to the 3 Year Warranty and Support provided as standard. Easy to setup. Coverage and bandwidth are impressive. The parental controls DO NOT WORK! Devices assigned with schedules stop working after a week? Wasted 5 hours troubleshooting my son's iPhone, which miraculously started woking fine when I flipped Parent Control off. Added my iPad to Parental control, and it too stopped working! Ability to turn of DPI for sip, which is needed with my environment.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff C

customer_reviews.title: Without a doubt the best router I’ve ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: I had a Linksys Gaming router before the AC5400 and was impressed with it, but it lacked the range I needed so I used a range extender. I recently upgraded my internet speed but I really wasn’t getting the full potential of my WiFi speed. I read some reviews and decided to try this router, OMG I not only found that I no longer needed the range extender but my speeds went from 80Mbps to 118Mbps And I only pay for 100. I could of also saved on my switch too as this has 8 ports instead of 4. Without a doubt the best router I’ve ever purchased!!!
customer_reviews.author: William Ansel

customer_reviews.title: Best Speed
customer_reviews.text: I have always used Linksys products for home networking. This is the latest in the line of products and I'm not disappointed. We all like to stream movies and videos in this family and this router delivers the best streaming for us. Anyone can stream HD video on any device simultaneously without buffering or loss of quality. The only downside is that my WRT3200ACM had better range. Aside from that, I give this router 5 stars overall.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Benson

customer_reviews.title: networking problems with the hard drives via usb
customer_reviews.text: fast, network hard drives need smb1 protocol in windows 10. go to control panels -> programs and features-> turn windows features on or off--> smb 1.0 and all 3 parts of it must be turned on. this solution was revealed to me when linksys directly called me after my case was escalated. i was very impressed. see pic below for how to turn this on. i have dhcp problems, i have maybe over 50 devices. linksys dhcp router stops and no longer assigns ip addresses.
customer_reviews.author: HVAC McPhillips

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I did my research and as of Sept 2019 this is one of the best routers to own. It’s great for multiple users, gamers, streaming, working from home, etc.. So when I priced it out and it was pretty pricey, I decided to try a “used” version. Unfortunately the one I received had a broken antenna. But the company was top-notch and let me return the router trouble free. So I can vouch for their great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Speed Queen

customer_reviews.title: I have great 100 meg down and up fiber to premises at ...
customer_reviews.text: Obligatory "It doubled my speed" is actually true for me. I have great 100 meg down and up fiber to premises at my house and this allowed me to actually pull a full speed. My old junk netgear was only getting me around 40 megs of speed but with this I'm pushing 90. I bought it for the tri-band mumimo technology because I live in a condo building with tons of wifi interference. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: good product. doesn't have quite the range I expected
customer_reviews.text: good product. doesn't have quite the range I expected. I expected to get a suntan from the thing and it does reach further than my previous router but the tv on the floor directly underneath doesn't get 5-bar reception, although I don't experience buffering using Netflix, etc. so, don't buy this if your internet appliances are far from the router; get a distributed system instead. If your internet products are close, it's a good product.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Got exactly what I paid for, excellence.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely changed my wifi experience in the house. I'm coming from an Asus N router that barely covered my house floor plan (single story 2700ft). Plugged this beast in get a solid 90-100% signal throughout the house. The speed has become close to par with Ethernet. Have 300Mps 30Mps, eithernet gets around 360Mps, wifi averages 290-300. Upload gets 33-40 on both. This was a huge gain for me and was exactly why I purchased this router. On a side note, the 5ghz bands made streaming 4K seem like child's play. This router is a beast. If you got the cash, this is a great router.
customer_reviews.author: Ctrl-Z

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router! Was using the Apple AirPort Extreme before and it was good but time for an update! I love how many Ethernet ports there are on this router, eliminates the need for a switch! It has great build quality and the software is very simple! The Linksys smart WiFi is an amazing feature, I use the app all the time just to check on things. It also has great coverage, great signal throughout my entire house! Love this router, highly recommend. I was also looking at ASUS Nighthawks but I found a lot of people were having them die on them so I chose this one instead and I am happy I did so!
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: Stability issues but overall it seems to be a decent router
customer_reviews.text: The router seems to work well with Comcast and it's gigabit network. I get fast speeds and zero drops on the wifi network when it's working correctly. I did have an issue though so it's not a completely happy ending with this product. Whenever I turn on logging the router seems to just want to stop working after a day or two. I have had to reset it a couple of times now since I have turned on that feature. Once I turned off logging it seems to be pretty stable again. Fingers are crossed.
customer_reviews.author: Billy R

customer_reviews.title: Stable wifi
customer_reviews.text: I been using the Linksys AC5400 for a week now with no problems. My old router was a TP Link tri-band. The Linksys has much better distance and seems more stable. I have had no dropping of signal and I am using over 20 wifi and ethernet devices. I did lock my 2.4 ghz channel but left the 5 ghz band channels roam. The app seems flawless and is a handy tool. I recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Everything works as described except PARENTAL CONTROL
customer_reviews.text: I loved this modem since I upgrade a previous linksys AC1900 model. It definetly works better in every sense, but the feature of PARENTAL CONTROL doesn't work propertly. I really need to control what my kids see on each device we have at home and that's why I chose to keep with Linksys. But this feature sometimes work, sometimes doesn't (like my kids can continue using internet or certain sites even I have set the restriction) or worst it blocks entirely the internet access to the "controled" devices. This issue has been reported by different users worldwide but until now there isn't a solution in place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT WIFI
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the investment. Easy setup and worked immediately when I plugged it in and have never had to do anything else. The price was well worth it. Excellent range, no more buffing and we are using over 9 devices at once. I highly recommend this product. I did not rate Tech support because I have never had to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F. Hart

customer_reviews.title: AMAZON HAD THE BEST PRICE NO HASSLE PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: I was using an older ASUS wifi router. I had 3 PC desktops 2 printers and added 10 of Amazons Echo, shows etc. The Asus finally choked through everything into a tail spin. I read a review on the LINKSYS AC5400.. AMAZON HAD THE BEST PRICE NO HASSLE PURCHASE. I tried another company who was selling it for 313. I got so much hassle. I told them where they could go buy Amazon. This router has so much wifi fire power WOW! It take as everything I through at it smiles and asks for mo!. Get it set up was a snap. Don't get one... then suffer! I am not!
customer_reviews.author: lovemystuff69

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Happy With This Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very Happy with my purchase. While pricey well worth the expense. Had it installed by Amazon's In Home Service. Sat down with the technician and set up the router. His knowledge of router and Ring Devices gave me clear instructions. Made it easy to set up and I didn't have to reset up all my 25 security devices. Wifi signal strength is now incredible as well as the range.
customer_reviews.author: ArtM10

customer_reviews.title: Some trade-offs on security for convenience
customer_reviews.text: This is a rock solid unit, very easy to configure, and has lots of great features. I'm rating it 2 stars because there is a serious trade-off on the security side. It does offer guest network capability which is great... but it's only protected by a captive portal. There is no way to enable WPA2/WPA encryption on the guest WIFI network (done clearly for convenience). In order to offer guests a way to connect securely, I'd have to share my primary network... which negates the network isolation the guest network provides. Seriously considering returning the unit and getting something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Bad: - wired throughput from LAN to Internet drops ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price , didn’t meet expectations. The Bad: - wired throughput from LAN to Internet drops down to 40Mbps from 200Mbps ( with Optimum 200Mbps) when Device prioritization is turnedin. - Features like bandwidth utilization on WAN uplink and LAN ports are not available - would love to see Top talkers reports The Good: - streaming video from NAS to PC/ cell was pretty smooth with simultaneous access - Parental Control meets requirements and works . Wish to be more granular like blocking YouTube contents - easy UI for non techies
customer_reviews.author: customer@amazon

customer_reviews.title: Blazing fast, but make sure you have a good ISP and modem to match
customer_reviews.text: Blazing fast wired and wireless. I'm getting over 300 MB download speeds on wired and wireless connections on my laptop.. My outdated phone got 127 MB on wireless. You have to have a ISP that gives you the access to higher speeds and a modem that can handle it, but you should get what you're paying for with this router provided that you have the service provider and modem necessary for those speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Clgood

customer_reviews.title: Router works great... until it doesn't.
customer_reviews.text: Then, you have to get on the phone with Linksys Technical Support which is staffed with some of the most stupid people I've ever encountered. After 1.5 hours on the phone, their diagnosis was that "this router is not performing correctly", (duh!) and that I'd get an email with a form I could fill out for a replacement, but they had no idea when that would happen. When I inquired as to whether I was just supposed to do without WiFi while I waited, the answer was, "Yes." Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Visual-Eyes

customer_reviews.title: Powerful WiFi with easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Just plug in the power and connect to the wifi label on the bottom of the access point. It will automatically open your browser and walk you through the rest of the simple setup. If it ask for the default password (not the WiFi password) it's admin all lowercase. After replacing my old WiFi access point all the wireless security cameras in my house could stream at high quality with no issues!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Linksys AC5400, Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: Setup was pretty easy. I initially had problems with sporadic connections to the web interface, but after contacting tech support (who were very helpful) and disabling ipv6, everything worked fine. Been using the AC5400 for 2 weeks now without a restart, and no problems. There are plenty of features, and speeds are great. I especially like the 2.0 and 3.0 USB ports, for making it easier to access files on the local network & over the internet. I've had a few Linksys routers in the past, and have always had good experiences with them, and so far this one is no exception. And, I got a great deal for Black Friday!
customer_reviews.author: Terry L Lockwood

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding purchase
customer_reviews.text: Had to upgrade due to so many WiFi capable components in house. Old router did great until I started lOsing 2.4ghz band in occasion. This new Linksys dies outstanding in keeping signals to over 35 components at once, I know this because I use the cool Ap provided by Linksys. Overall great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Plug it  in and forget it. It works.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Plugged it in, connected it to my new modem, after some adjustments, it updated itself, I renamed all my private and guest SSIDs to my own settings from the defaults and it was off to the races. Ran speedtest.net and works as advertised.It screams and I only have a 100MB connection supposedly. I've had a fast ASUS router before but this happens to handle more devices at high speed. Prioritized some traffic to certain devices just to be fancy. It's only been a couple days but I haven't touched it since, and I get a solid signal in all parts of my apartment.
customer_reviews.author: Chris, Earthling

customer_reviews.title: Only router you will ever need.
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a wireless router to give you the speed you need for your entire house this is the one. Different bands to choose from and guest account..all with passwords you choose. Control it by your smartphone with a simple app that gives you the power to change everything even when you are not home. Micromanage settings if you are a power user and like to tinker with every single setting possible. It is wonderful..easy to set up..verbose yet simple. You will wonder why you waited so long to by a Linksys once you have this up and running!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast (EA9500). Besides the fact that it immediately increased my download speeds 70%, or the fact that it increased my reception, it is hard to accept its large footprint. This thing is gigantic, I went from a single box that was both my access point and cable modem to a separate cable modem and this for my access point. I mirrored this with the Linksys CM3024 and they seem to work well together. I am not a huge fan of the interface but do like the ability to remotely manage the router and see what devices are connected. I would recommend this product to a friend or family member.
customer_reviews.author: greg1174

customer_reviews.title: Best Wireless Router out there!
customer_reviews.text: Just to let you know I'm a computer/network tech for over 20 years now. This Wireless router is the best I've ever purchased. I've been an Asus fan for years but with their firmware issues and other compatibility issues it was time to make a change. At any given time we have over 30 devices on our home network. Linksys has been in the network game for decades and they're doing it right. As soon as I set it up I didn't have any connectivity issues or SSID issues like I had with the Asus router. I owned the Asus Rt-AC88U and will never look back. Thank you Linksys!
customer_reviews.author: Blue Screen Of Death

customer_reviews.title: Great for smart homes
customer_reviews.text: I’m a longtime user of Linksys and when I moved into a larger home with smart technology and significant WiFi demands, I decided to upgrade to this model. Strong signal throughout my 3409 sq feet and 4K streaming on my Sony TV is breathtaking. Highly recommend this model for large multilevel homes and if you’re going to a smart house with a lot of internet act.
customer_reviews.author: TM24689

customer_reviews.title: Used item that was DOA
customer_reviews.text: I was completely disappointed when I opened the box and found what looked to be a well used item. In addition to that, the router doesn't even work. Plugged it in and got no power, no lights, nothing. I researched the seller on Amazon and was amazed at the number of negative reviews similar to mine. Used items sold as new, items not working, etc. DO NOT BUY ANYTHING FROM #1 Tech. If you do, you'll be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: MARTIN J JENKINS

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with this Router!
customer_reviews.text: Stepped up from a powerful D-Link device and this router simply out performs the D-Link 890 hands down - and it’s a powerful oerformer itself! The Linksys was soooo easy to configure and get up and running plus it has a great mobile app to run your router remotely. We have almost 60 WiFi devices in our home and 7 of those are constant-streaming HD security cameras - the Linksys handles it all flawlessly. As an IT pro, I have to highly recommend this router. We also purchased one of the Linksys range extenders because the D-Link has issues reach all the corners of the house but since we installed the AC5400, we haven’t needed the range extender.
customer_reviews.author: VB

customer_reviews.title: Best router currently on the market
customer_reviews.text: Great bandwidth with this router! I have a wireless printer that would not get enough bandwidth with the previous router and this solved that problem. It also gives better range for phones and tablets wifi signal. We also just recently got a smart tv and the old router would lag when streaming Amazon movies on it, but not anymore with this one. I believe this is currently the best router on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A. Krusey

customer_reviews.title: Horrible experience
customer_reviews.text: Easily the worst router I have owned. I purchased this router 10 months ago to replace an Apple airport arrangement for my narrow 3 story home. The range was not sufficient to cover without purchasing a linksys extender. Furthermore I suffer numerous lags, nest camera disconnections and generally poor performance. I have tweaked settings with the help of knowledgeable friends and reddit but to no avail. It has many useful Ethernet ports which is the reason for the 2 stars. After 10 months my hard earned $300+ Is going the way if the trash bin and I am looking for something reliable at the very least
customer_reviews.author: John Casey

customer_reviews.title: This is a beast of a router. The main ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a beast of a router. The main reason I got this was the 8 gigabit ports on the back. I was continually having issues with my switch and routing issues (did not want to get a managed switch) and I wanted a router that would work with gigabit internet that I will be getting soon. This thing does it all. If I have one gripe is that the GUI is very limited and no real advanced features for traffic flow and QoS. Overall, or my needs it does everything I need and is future proof (at least for the forseable future)
customer_reviews.author: D. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Typical
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers, my 5GHZ radio goes down every day meaning. My Laptop would constantly go from online to offline all day long. The speed is also a concern; I switched to ATT&T fiber and the speed from my ATT router is about 3 times faster than what the gigabit router is supposed to deliver.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Booher

customer_reviews.title: No more traffic jams!
customer_reviews.text: I'm no geek, so its just a regular user who spends time on the internet, but since we kept adding various items to the network, (3 laptops, 2 Roku's, 1 Blue Ray disk with internet access, a Squeezebox radio player, 2 Cellular phones that need wifi to work within the home due to lots of metal everywhere, AND a Wifi home phone base, our 'highway' was getting clogged. Now, no more. No more 'buffering' as we are watching the tv, and it is a noticeable difference in speed. As more technology could be added in the future, I feel prepared for it!!
customer_reviews.author: Arlene B

customer_reviews.title: Better than I hoped.
customer_reviews.text: The range on this is much better than I had expected. The speed is awesome, but you have to have a device that can take advantage of it, of course. The one device I have that can gets screaming connection speeds to the router. Over all, better than I had expected.
customer_reviews.author: Gary P.

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS A V1 EA9500  -  DOES NOT HAVE A QUAD CORE PROCESSOR!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router thinking I was receiving one with a quad core processor. Sadly I was very mistaken. While the router preforms well, I am very unhappy that neither Amazon nor Linksys were clear that the EA9500 being sold here is a V1 router.
customer_reviews.author: reader

customer_reviews.title: Had been greatly disappointed with a different manufacturer's product (bird of the night ...
customer_reviews.text: Had been greatly disappointed with a different manufacturer's product (bird of the night 8); after resetting the old router for the 5th time, was done. Spoke with some IT professionals and the repeated recommendation was this router. Noticed an impressive improvement in performance and user-friendliness. Highly recommend. Very satisfied after 1 week
customer_reviews.author: NEPA Koss

customer_reviews.title: Ea9500 Started dropping connects after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: Like many people here who have been having with this expensive router, the wifi completely drops every device in my house. Both the 2.4ghz and 5ghz disappears and becomes unscannable. Resetting will make them show up again, until the next time it dies. Linksys troubleshooting shooting takes the longest time. Be prepared to answer tedious questions like, "Are you using the same power adapter that came with the router?:
customer_reviews.author: Why Win

customer_reviews.title: Great Improvement.
customer_reviews.text: Had Centurylink supplied modem and wireless router combination producing inconsistent speeds and wireless signal strength as time when on. The Linksys AC5400 was easy to set up and provided consistent speeds and coverage throughout the house. It does take up some space. The Linksys app worked on both iPad and Android systems. It has automatic firmware updates included. Would recommend this product as an upgrade for older wireless router.
customer_reviews.author: D. Young

customer_reviews.title: Best router I've owned so far
customer_reviews.text: I've had different routers from different vendors. My favorite was the Apple AirPort base station and it's a shame that Apple stopped making them. I wasn't going to think that another router was going to come along and be as simple as the Apple AirPort until this Linksys Tri-Band model came out. Kudos to Linksys for coming up with a simple, easy to use router and yet with a lot of powerful features to utilize. The only thing I wish Linksys can update on their web interface is the option to upload my own icons for the network map because there are limitations here in using only the images they provide. But overall, it is definitely a great product.
customer_reviews.author: stevemb425

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Tri-Band Router
customer_reviews.text: When your ISP provided router just won't cut it. Time to get one of these bad boys. A one time investment that will prevent you from disconnecting the power from your otherwise "okay" router. It can handle whatever you throw at it. If you have more than 5 internet devices at home, buy this. I really like the Linksys App too. So simple to setup and use. Advanced port forwarding and prioritization features. Notifications to your phone if your internet goes down.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Great router with good range, could definitely use a spec upgrade with more ram and faster processor.
customer_reviews.text: I had an issue with the first router where it just kept restarting on its own so had to send it in for an exchange. The second one so far been about a month without issues. However the range is not as great as i had hoped, speed is great even on the second floor about 4 rooms down i still manage to connect at around 5-600Mbps on the 5G channel where the old Nighthawk would connect only at 2-300Mbps.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: ohhh yes love it but tech support and warranty stinks
customer_reviews.text: super fast and very easy to set up, I love the fact that it has 8 ports, got rid of my switch, but when it breaks good luck with tech support, they keep you on the phone for hours with nothing done about the broker router, the lights started going out on the back and after about 3 hours all lights for the ports out and nothing that was connected works, tech support wanted me to get an IP address that wasn't there because the wired ports were out, thank goodness the wifi still works. going to buy another one tomorrow. great router super fast, just there tech support and warranty isn't worth the paper its written on.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Higginbottom

customer_reviews.title: When it’s good it’s very good
customer_reviews.text: When it’s good it’s very good. When it’s bad it sucks. Have to restart it to often. Works pretty well for steaming most of the time. But doesn’t it handle traffic that well. It seems to get worse when a WiFi access point is added. But pretty fast when it is working. And if you only had a few demanding devices. I have 4 power users. They all stream. I have 8 devices hardwired Ethernet and another 8 or so on WiFi. Just not as stable as I had hope but works for the most part.
customer_reviews.author: R. Buettner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent piece of equipment for gaming/home office use.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent wireless router. It delivers excellent speeds over all bands, and offers a superb range as well. The interface is pretty standard as far as linksys smart routers go, so it was quite simple to enter and setup. While it lacks the bells and whistles of other routers branded as "Gaming Routers" this is still a viable option for gaming and/or home office use. I would say this is not a router for the average internet user. Takes a little longer than i would like to boot up, but that is my only complaint to date, which i would say is a non-issue in the grand scheme of things.
customer_reviews.author: Derek McCall

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME
customer_reviews.text: Having spent over $300 on this supposedly high power router I have been so disappointed in its underwhelming performance - no range - only works well when you are 10 ft from it. I have G/bit internet and this dog pile had failed us miserably. Parental controls don’t work properly - user interface is appalling- tech support is a crackly line to the 3rd world
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Stop working after 4 months of use
customer_reviews.text: After more than four months of use, this router stop working and start self-reboot every minute. Very disappointed with this router. Linksys usually have reliable products but I don't know what happened to this particular model. After reset to manufacturers’ default settings the router still self-reboot infinitely. The hardware version of this one is EA9500 v1.1. I hope the manufacturer fix this problem in later version.
customer_reviews.author: Andromeda

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: even though i deal with computers and network devices daily, let me say this one is a no brainer. The one thing i found troublesome was i couldn't complete set up without an internet connection. Speed is great connections are stable kids love me once again. hoping that later his year i can finally buy there love with that pony i promised them.
customer_reviews.author: Keithdan

customer_reviews.title: Dropped 2.4GHz network
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about the first year and a half but then started dropping the 2.4Ghz network. Wouldn't be that big of a deal but there are certain devices that only connect through 2.4Ghz network (PS4, Nest Smoke detectors, . . .etc). I contacted Linksys and they couldn't get the 2.4Ghz network back up and running. I've dealt with it for the past year and a half but now I'm fed up and going to buy another router. Bummer that spending $300 on a router and it only functioned correctly for a little over a year. :(
customer_reviews.author: Rich Fitzsimmons

customer_reviews.title: Poor coverage
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1750 sq ft house and the wi-fi signal barely reaches the bedroom. True, the router is in the back of the house in the office and the bedroom is in the front of the house, but we are only talking about 50-60 feet. Way too expensive for such poor coverage. Looks like I might have to buy a booster to get the signal up in the bedroom, a total waste since this thing was supposed to cover a 4000 sq ft house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this router
customer_reviews.text: Love this router! My wireless network speed on my iPad went from 40 Mbps to 80 Mbps. My upload speeds doubled as well, going from 4 Mbps to 8 Mbps. So far (knock on wood) I haven't had to reset my network once since installing the new router. Before installing the new router, I was having to reset my older Cisco router about once every other day. See picture so my new transmission speeds.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: No connection and no customer support. Expensive paper weight
customer_reviews.text: Had a power surge due to a storm. Now I have to reset the router every hour because it just randomly looses connection to all devices in the house. I tried contacting customer support and the human on the other end took 20 minutes to respond and then disconnected the chat as soon as I was able to tell her the problem
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Stable connection
customer_reviews.text: This is replacing a Netgear Nighthawk router. The previous router (which was pretty new) had received bad firmware updates and for half the time I owned required almost daily reboots in order to have internet access. Netgear released multiple updates to "fix" this issue but none of them worked and in fact the issue kept getting worse. I was able to quickly install the new router and have had no problems with it since installing.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Solid build and performance...
customer_reviews.text: *** Update 101517*** It stopped working recently and Linksys replaced it under warranty. I like having the 8 ports for wired connection for other devices. Great device. This thing is overkill for a reason. Handles all traffic on my network. Almost everything now has wifi. I watched two 4k movies back to back with no issues. Also, having 8 ports, is a plus where I can add things like a printer, TV, etc to free up wifi. Will see how it performs down the road. So far very happy with performance.
customer_reviews.author: Farm Hand

product_meta.title: Linksys Tri-Band Wifi Router for Home (Max-Stream AC5400 MU-Mimo Fast Wireless Router), Black
product_meta.description: Style:AC5400Next Gen AC2 Wi Fi utilizes Multi User MIMO technology to improve productivity in your home office while keeping your family's Wi Fi devices online at the same time and the same speed. Refer to page 15 in User Manual for troubleshooting steps.
feature_bullets: Provides up to 3,000 square feet of WiFi coverage for 25+ wireless devices
Works with existing modem, simple setup through Linksys App
Enjoy 4K HD streaming, gaming and more in high quality without buffering
Tri band router delivers the fastest combined WiFi speeds to all your devices
Tri band WiFi speeds up to 5.3 Gbps (5 GHz / 1000 Mbps) + (5 GHz / 2166 Mbps) + (2.4 GHz / 2166 Mbps)
MU MIMO (Multi User Multiple Input Multiple Output) provides WiFi to multiple devices at once, at the same high speed

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars10,858 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
